Apr 28, 2021 • Less than a minute read • ["recommended", "technology", "gadgets", "niche", "games", "gaming", "resolution", "my life in gaming"]

4k to 280p

I’m very skeptical of the bandwagon that gets pushed along the “bit perfect” trail, and I appreciate the irony of these perfection seekers flat out decimating modern games to fit their nostalgia tastes. That being said, I think it’s still a super intriquing concept. There are such cool things to see when somebody shows you what to look for.

Digital Foundry also did a great video from a developers perspective. I like the potential this gives me to say it’s the game developer’s problem if my low-midrange pc can’t handle the graphics. “Just give me the downscaled, smoother frames! That’s easier for you, isn’t it?”
